meanings.definition: Of or relating to a type of soil characterized by a leached, acidic, infertile layer
meanings.sent1: The podzolic soil in the forest lacked nutrients for plants to grow well.
meanings.sent2: The farmer avoided planting crops in the podzolic area due to its poor quality.
meanings.sent3: The podzolic ground was so sour that even the weeds refused to grow there.
meanings.sent4: Her garden, once lush and vibrant, now resembled a podzolic wasteland.
meanings.sent5: The podzolic soil, like a barren wasteland, rejected any attempts at cultivation.

meanings.definition: A type of soil found in cool, moist climates, typically under coniferous forests
meanings.sent1: The podzolic under the pine trees retained moisture well.
meanings.sent2: Hikers enjoyed the soft feel of the podzolic soil beneath their feet.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels in the podzolic soil seemed to move with extra bounce in their step.
meanings.sent4: The podzolic earth cradled the roots of the towering conifers like a protective blanket.
meanings.sent5: The podzolic terrain whispered secrets of ancient forests to those who listened closely.
